Description: Shoulder fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery closed vase; black tongues preserved at top of shoulder; below, an incised circular rosette. Paint partly fired to red (10 R 5/6).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 10, no. 27 pl. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.895)
